title: Lionel Messi reveals that several Barcelona members are opposed to a reunion with PSG star Neymar
text:
Lionel Messi has revealed that several individuals at Barcelona are opposed to a reunion with PSG star Neymar.

The Brazilian attacker had departed the Nou Camp in 2017 amid controversial circumstances and opted to move to Paris for a world-record fee.

But Neymar was heavily linked with a return to Spain this summer - although former team-mate Messi believes that the manner of his original switch could scupper a return in the future.

Lionel Messi revealed that several individuals at Barcelona are opposed to a move for Neymar

'It is difficult to bring him back,' the 32-year-old Argentine told Metro 95.1.

'Firstly, because it was difficult to see him leave, secondly because of how he left.

'There are people from the club and the members who do not want him to return.

'If it is for sports, Ney is one of the best in the world, but I understand all the other factors.'

Neymar, despite scoring 51 goals in 58 appearances in the French capital, had reportedly attempted to engineer a move away this summer.

Neymar reportedly attempted to engineer a move away from Paris Saint-Germain this summer

The reigning French champions also purportedly offered Neymar out to Europe's elite sides on a loan deal, which would have featured a £200million obligation to buy clause.

His vocal desire to leave had angered the majority of PSG supporters, and the enigmatic 27-year-old remains in the process of regaining their favour despite several match-winning moments of magic this term.

According to The Athletic, Manchester United decided against a move for the superstar after concerns from figures at Old Trafford surrounding his party lifestyle and dedication to his profession.

And Messi previously admitted his belief that Real Madrid would swoop for the former Santos man after Barcelona had pulled out of the tussle for his signature.

Messi admitted that he believed Florentino Perez and Real Madrid would swoop for the star

'I really thought Neymar would go to Real Madrid if he didn't come here,' he said in an interview with RAC1.

'He really wanted to leave Paris and he'd shown it.

'And I thought that Florentino [Perez] and Real Madrid were going to do something to sign him.'

Neymar is currently sidelined after sustaining a hamstring strain in Brazil's draw with Nigeria this week, and isn't expected to return to action for four weeks.
description: Lionel Messi has revealed that several individuals at Barcelona are opposed to a reunion with PSG star Neymar. The Brazilian attacker had departed the Nou Camp in 2017.
